revised_title: Internal Resistance, Internal Friction, and Sound Transmission in Fluids
tldr: The author investigates the transmission of sound through fluids, considering the effects of internal resistance and internal friction. They develop equations to represent these forces and discuss the differences in how waves of condensation and rarefaction are transmitted. The author also explores the possibility that only aerial rarefactions stimulate the human ear, leading to a better understanding of hearing and sound perception.
